intro: Stachys tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán mint, is a perennial herb native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem. Stachys tucumanensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
